risk_description: Mobile OS battery optimization and background execution limits (iOS/Android) may aggressively terminate the technician background location tracking service, causing data gaps and failing the <2s latency requirement.
root_cause: Native mobile operating systems prioritize battery life over background processes, requiring specialized implementation to maintain persistent WebSocket connections or frequent GPS polling.
mitigation_strategy: Implement a robust foreground service for Android and 'Always' location permissions for iOS. Utilize a specialized commercial-grade library (e.g., TransistorSoft) rather than generic open-source plugins. Implement local buffering of coordinates to handle connection drops.
contingency_plan: Fallback to SMS-based location pings or server-side polling if WebSocket connection is unstable or terminated by OS.
monitoring_trigger: Technician location update gaps exceeding 60 seconds in staging environments during movement simulation.

risk_description: Complex PostGIS point-in-polygon queries combined with dynamic service center availability checks may exceed the P95 <250ms latency requirement under high load (10k users).
root_cause: Geospatial queries on complex polygons are computationally expensive, and when combined with real-time logic (availability/round-robin) in a single synchronous transaction, performance degrades.
mitigation_strategy: Implement rigorous spatial indexing (GIST) on PostgreSQL. Cache simplified polygon definitions in Redis for rapid pre-filtering. Offload non-critical routing logic to background workers via Azure Service Bus.
contingency_plan: Scale up PostgreSQL SKU or implement read replicas specifically for geospatial read operations.
monitoring_trigger: Routing API endpoint latency exceeds 200ms during load testing of 500 concurrent requests.

risk_description: Offline-first data synchronization conflicts in the User App (WatermelonDB/Realm) may lead to data corruption or loss when syncing warranty/product data back to the server.
root_cause: Bi-directional sync logic is inherently complex; concurrent modifications on different devices or server-side updates while a device is offline create collision scenarios.
mitigation_strategy: Adopt a strict 'Last-Write-Wins' policy or 'Server-Authority' model. Implement granular sync endpoints (diffs only). Design API to be idempotent to handle retry storms after network restoration.
contingency_plan: Disable offline write capabilities for critical data; limit offline mode to read-only access for cached warranty cards.
monitoring_trigger: Sync error rate exceeds 1% during network interruption simulation tests.

risk_description: Azure AD B2C custom policy configuration for complex multi-role RBAC (Super Admin, Brand Admin, Technician) requires niche XML skills, creating a dependency bottleneck.
root_cause: Azure AD B2C Identity Experience Framework (IEF) uses complex XML configuration which is distinct from standard OAuth/OIDC implementation skills common in Node.js teams.
mitigation_strategy: Engage an Identity Specialist consultant for initial setup. Utilize Azure AD B2C Starter Packs. Implement a mock auth service for local development to prevent blocking backend developers.
contingency_plan: Simplify RBAC implementation to manage roles within the application database instead of token claims, reducing B2C complexity.
monitoring_trigger: Auth-related tickets blocked for >3 days due to configuration issues.

risk_description: User-uploaded invoices (PDF/Images) may contain malware, which could propagate to internal systems or other users if not sanitized immediately upon upload.
root_cause: Allowing public file uploads is a primary attack vector. Processing these files (e.g., for OCR or display) executes code that could trigger exploits.
mitigation_strategy: Integrate Azure Defender for Storage (Malware Scanning). quarantine uploaded blobs until scan completes. Use sandboxed parsers for file validation.
contingency_plan: Disable instant availability of uploaded documents; enforce a processing delay to allow asynchronous scanning.
monitoring_trigger: Detection of any unscanned file access in Blob Storage logs.

risk_description: Kubernetes (AKS) complexity regarding networking (Azure CNI) and Ingress configuration may delay environment readiness and complicate troubleshooting.
root_cause: The requirement for microservices orchestration on AKS introduces significant operational overhead compared to PaaS (App Service), specifically regarding VNet integration and ingress controllers.
mitigation_strategy: Use Terraform modules with proven defaults. Implement GitOps (ArgoCD or Flux) for declarative configuration management. Ensure dev team has 'bridge to kubernetes' or similar local debug tools.
contingency_plan: Downgrade non-critical services to Azure Container Apps if AKS management overhead becomes unsustainable.
monitoring_trigger: Infrastructure provisioning time exceeds 4 hours or repeated Terraform apply failures.
